metadata.title: CVE-2021-20266 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in RPM's hdrblobInit() in lib/header.c. This flaw allowsan attacker who can modify the rpmdb to cause an out-of-bounds read. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

debugedit - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpm8 - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmbuild8 - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmio8 - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
librpmsign8 - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-rpm - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-rpm - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm-common - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm-i18n - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
rpm2cpio - 4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: rpm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.14.2.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
